content: For those who don't know, a Territorial Army Soldier is a British Army reservist. quote: British soldier escapes death when Taliban bullet passes through helmet Private Leon "Willy" Wilson, 32, said he was left without a mark after the high-velocity round tore through his head protection. The Territorial Army soldier, on attachment with 2nd Battalion of the Mercian Regiment (Worcesters and Foresters), was knocked flat on his back by the impact of the shot. Pte Wilson had been manning a machine gun during a fierce battle with the Taliban in Helmand Province on April 10 when he was hit by the 7.62mm AK47 bullet, the Ministry of Defence said. The father of three from Manchester said: "I took my finger off the trigger when the shot hit my helmet. (...) The soldier, who is a self-employed electrician when not on active duty, was back in the thick of the fighting within an hour after finding a new helmet. (...) The gun battle came after British and Afghan soldiers destroyed an insurgent bomb factory in the village of Khowshhal Kalay. They were fired on after sheltering overnight in a compound. Pte Wilson was wearing a Mark 6a helmet, which is made from several layers of Kevlar armour. He is now back in Camp Bastion, where phoned his girlfriend. (...) Pte Wilson's commander, Captain Rob Agnew said the "luckiest Private" in the army, adding: "Willy's a good lad - and a good soldier." ++http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/newstopics/onthefrontline/5185889/British-soldier-escapes-death-when-Taliban-bullet-passes-through-helmet.html

content: Why did it go through a kevlar helmet??? Was not that usual for a bullet to penetrate the old steel pot, stay between the helmet and liner, and come out on the side. I often wondered why they didn't make a kevlar liner for the steel pot. Then you'd still have your wash basin and cooking pot!! Wandering and Wondering
